Sure, here is the information about the Roman festival of Saturnalia in bullet points:

* Saturnalia was an ancient Roman festival held in December in honor of the god Saturn.
* It was one of the oldest and most popular festivals in the Roman calendar.
* During Saturnalia, the usual social norms were reversed and slaves were given the day off and allowed to participate in the festivities, including gambling.
* Masters would serve their slaves and there was a general sense of revelry and inversion of the usual social order.
* Gift-giving was an important part of Saturnalia and people would exchange small presents such as candles, figurines, and sweets.
* Decorations, including wreaths and garlands, were used to celebrate the festival.
* Saturnalia was a time of feasting and merriment, with people coming together to enjoy banquets, drink wine, and sing songs.
* The festival was seen as a time to let loose, put aside the usual strictures of society, and simply enjoy life.
* Saturnalia was an important festival that helped to bring the community together and was eagerly anticipated each year.
